page.title: 15STUDLAND GEOLOGY
page.content: The geology of the Studland area divides easily into bands running roughly East/West. To the North is{ {Studland Heath}(Bagshot Beds),sandy, with little nourishment (Podsol).This is dotted with marshy areas and old gravel diggings.{The Agglestone}a huge,irony,sandstone rock, is a prominent feature.Recent surveys have revealed the presence of oil here and test drilling has taken place.The seashore of this heath is Duneland, built up over 200 years and still progressing Eastwards. South of the heath fertile, sloping farmland, (London Clay)leads to the high chalk ridge of{Ballard Down}and{Godlingston {Hill}split by the steep valley running North/South known as{Ulwell Gap}.There is evidence of flint working and ancient settlements.
